â­ Talking about feelings with your child will help them learn how to express themselves.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Letâ€™s see how @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name handles his granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_8.name, when she feels jealous.

character_1_text.eng: Thaatha, why donâ€™t we have a huge screen TV like my friend, Peggie?

rows.character_1_text: Thaatha, why donâ€™t we have a huge screen TV like my friend, Peggie?
I see that you are upset, @data.characters.f2_daughter_8.name. It is hard when your friends have things that we canâ€™t have.

character_1_text.eng: I see that you are upset, @data.characters.f2_daughter_8.name. It is hard when your friends have things that we canâ€™t have.

rows.character_1_text: What do you mean, Thaatha? I really want a huge TV.

character_1_text.eng: What do you mean, Thaatha? I really want a huge TV.

character_2_text.eng: I understand, @data.characters.f2_daughter_8.name. We work hard, but TVs are expensive. We can still have fun and play as a family.

rows.character_2_text: I understand, @data.characters.f2_daughter_8.name. We work hard, but TVs are expensive. We can still have fun and play as a family.

rows.text_1_facilitator: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are 5 tips for how you can help your child learn how to cope with their emotions: LEARN, NOTICE, OPEN, TALK, and CARE.

text_1_facilitator.eng: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are 5 tips for how you can help your child learn how to cope with their emotions: LEARN, NOTICE, OPEN, TALK, and CARE.

section_1_text.eng:
ğŸ’¡ Learn about different emotions. 
ğŸ˜ƒ The 6 basic emotions are: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid.
ğŸ‘€ You can use facial expressions and physical movements to help your child learn different emotions. Make it a game!
ğŸ¨ As children grow, they learn to identify more emotions, like excitement, frustration, pride, loneliness, calm, guilt and confusion.

section_2_text.eng:
ğŸ‘€ Notice all emotions in your child. 
ğŸ˜ƒ You can also share positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness.
ğŸ’™ This allows them to appreciate the beautiful moments!

section_3_text.eng:
Notice ğŸ‘€ and listen ğŸ‘‚ to your child when they share how they are feeling. 
ğŸ’› Accept how they feel.
ğŸ§¸ Give them comfort.

section_4_text.eng:
ğŸ˜’ It is normal to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings. 
ğŸ‘‹ Remember, it is also normal to experience feelings in different ways.
ğŸ’¡ Learn to identify your own emotions, to experience them in our body, and to communicate about them

section_5_text.eng:
ğŸŒ· Use your actions or words to support your child and make them feel accepted and loved. You can hug or praise them!
ğŸ’š Remind your child that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.

rows.quiz_1_question:
Home activity! â­ Talk about feelings with your child during one-on-one time today. Use words or expressions to describe both your own feelings and your childâ€™s feelings - like â€œI am happy to see you, your child,â€ or â€œYou look sad that playtime is over, your child.â€ Try this at least 3 times - make it fun!

Can you do it today?
